data.title: Lakehead University Courses, Fees, Rankings, Deadlines, Placements, and Scholarships
data.meta_description: Lakehead University and its business schools are internationally accredited by the AACSB. The University has campuses  in Thunder Bay and Orillia, Ontario, Canada.
data.text:
Lakehead University QS ranking for the year 2022 was 1,310 in the World University Rankings. Lakehead University acceptance rate ranges approximately 82%-85% for the incoming students. The University offers more than 65 programs of various levels of study. Lakehead University IELTS requirement and TOEFL requirements are also necessary for international students. Candidates should maintain a proper GPA of at least 60% in most programs for securing admission. There are various top Universities in Canada that offers quality education to candidates in relevant fields. The Lakehead University Canada fees for international students on an average basis is CAD 36,100 (INR 22,24,545.18). The average salary that a graduate of Lakehead University Canada earns is CAD 67,750 (INR 41,77,118.40).

Why to Choose Lakehead University?

Some of the reasons to choose Lakehead University programs are given below:

Lakehead University graduate employment rate is over 94%

Lakehead had the 8th highest 7-year graduation rate among all Ontario universities.

A Lakehead alum’s annual salary 2 years after graduating is CAD 53,200(INR 32,78,958.10)

Research Infosource ranked Lakehead University #1 in Canada in its category of not-for-profit research income

Candidates earn an average salary of CAD 67,750 (INR 41,77,118.40) after graduating from Lakehead University.

Lakehead University Ranking

Candidates must check the Canada University rankings before applying. The Lakehead University Canada ranking according to various ranking bodies is given below:

#1,310 in the QS World University Rankings, 2022

#1,291 in Best Global Universities in the U.S. News and World Report, 2023

#801-1,000 in the Times Higher Education World University Rankings, 2023

Lakehead University Acceptance Rate

Candidates would require a study permit or work permit if they get the opportunity for any internship or job. As compared to the other universities in Canada, this university is lightly selective in the admission process. The Lakehead University acceptance rate for international students ranges around 82%-85%.

Number of undergraduate students: 5,838

Number of graduate students: 891

Number of international students: 2,024

Lakehead University Application Deadlines

There are also several cheap Universities in Canada that offer courses within a less fee structure. Candidates should surely check the program specific deadline, if any, for the particular term and then proceed for Lakehead University admissions. The Lakehead University application deadlines are tabulated below:

For Lakehead University Undergraduate Programs

Term Deadline Fall 2023 March 1, 2023 (Extended) Spring/Summer 2023 April 1, 2023 (Closed) Winter, 2023 November 1, 2022 (Closed) Deferral of admission (Fall entry) August 31, 2023

For Lakehead University Graduate Programs

Term Deadline Fall start term February 1 Winter start term September 30 Spring start term January 15

Lakehead University Application Process

Candidates must make sure to take care of the incurring costs to study in Canada. Candidates are advised to properly undergo the application process of Lakehead University masters programs as well as undergraduate programs and then apply:

Research for the programs

Review requirements and fill up the application

Check deadlines of the preferred program

International candidates must provide scores of IELTS, TOEFL, PTE etc.

Upload your personal as well as academic documents

Provide any other program specific documents

Apply for visa and immigration documents

Arrange for housing and meal plans

Pay the Lakehead University application fee of CAD 135 (INR 8,321)

Review all the information before submitting

Submit the application

Keep a track on the status of application

Accept the confirmation letter, if received

Pay the tuition fees of your preferred program

Register for classes

Register for Orientation

Book your travel to Canada

Confirm Your Use of Airport Pick-Up Service

Sign up for a peer mentor

Make your pre-departure planning

Documents Required For Lakehead University Applicants

Candidate must understand the Canada PR process for studying in Canada. There are various Lakehead University Admission requirements some of which are mentioned below:

Completed application form

Bachelor’s degree or diploma if applying for Lakehead University graduate programs

Official transcripts are required from past institutions

Language Proficiency requirements of IELTS, TOEFL, DET or PTE, CAEL

High school degree or certificate if applying for an undergraduate program

Course Syllabi

Consent form

Reference letters

Program specific documents

Pay the Lakehead University application fee of CAD 135 (INR 8,321)

Lakehead University Entry Requirements

Candidates should also keep in mind about the MBA in Canada fees before applying for the same. There are various score requirements for international students according to their level of study. However, the various scores and their range required for admission to the Lakehead University is given below.

Score Requirements for Lakehead University

The admission criteria for the Lakehead University MBA students as well as general students are tabulated below:

Admission criteria Score GPA Minimum 60% SAT score Optional ACT Optional GRE score 300 GMAT score 500

Lakehead University English Proficiency Requirements

International students must also understand the process of Canada PNP before applying for admission in Lakehead University. Here given below are the Lakehead University band requirements for international students of English proficiency:

Test Score Required TOEFL score 80 (no component score less than 19) (UG)

103 (no component score less than 24) (PG) IELTS score 6.5 (no individual score less than 6.0) (UG)

7.0 (no individual score less than 6.5) (PG) CAEL 60 DET score 110 (UG)

120 (PG) PTE score 58 (no component score less than 50) (UG)

65 (no component score less than 58) (PG)

The Lakehead University graduate tuition fees is CAD 7,666.66 (INR 4,72,523.51) per term for most of the programs. Candidates must surely check the Lakehead University deadlines for the program they are applying for.

FAQs

Ques. Which is the main campus of Lakehead University?

Ans. Lakehead University's main campus is located in the City of Thunder Bay. Located on the shores of Lake Superior in Northwestern Ontario, the City of Thunder Bay is truly 'superior by nature'.

Ques.What is Lakehead University known for?

Ans. Maclean's has once again ranked Lakehead University among Canada's top 10 primarily undergraduate universities in Canada in the 2023 University Rankings. For the fourth year in a row, Lakehead University has been included in the top half of the Times Higher Education list of the best universities from around the world.

Ques. Is Lakehead hard to get into?

Ans. Lakehead University has an acceptance rate of 83% which makes it quite easier to get into the university.

Ques. What is Thunder Bay known for?

Ans. Thunder Bay is home to a multicultural community of professional, skilled and creative people. Here you'll find a mix of modern city living and the best of nature – all on your doorstep. People come to Thunder Bay for small city affordability, big city opportunities and the bonus of a superior lifestyle.

Ques. How many campus does Lakehead University have?

Ans. Lakehead University's two main campus locations in Thunder Bay and Orillia, Ontario provides you with two exceptional campuses to discover. With Lakehead's partnership with Georgian College, we also now offer selected programs at the Georgian-Lakehead campus in Barrie, Ontario.

Ques. Why study in Thunder Bay?

Ans. Thunder Bay offers a beautiful and natural location in a vibrant, small Canadian city, which is famous for its focus on outdoor recreation, clean air, and an excellent university that attracts students from around the world.

Ques. Is GRE required for Lakehead University?

Ans. GMAT with recommended minimum score of 500, or a GRE General Exam with recommended minimum score 300.

Ques. What are the disadvantages of living in Thunder Bay?

Ans. When moving to such a diverse community, such as, Thunder Bay, one should be careful of the higher than normal murder rate. Thunder Bay has the highest murder rate per capita of any municipality in all of Canada. As well, be aware there are areas in town where these heinous crimes tend to occur.

Ques. Is Thunder Bay hot or cold?

Ans. Thunder Bay has a continental climate with warm to hot summers and cooler winters with a Great Lake moderating influence. Summer daytime temperatures vary from 15°C to 30°C (59°F to 86°F) while nights tend to be cooler and less humid than southern locations.

Ques. What is the success rate of Lakehead University visa?

Ans. The success rate of Lakehead University visa is 82%. This means that 82 out of 100 student visa receives approval in one fiscal year at Lakehead University.
